page.title: 08HUDSCOTT
page.content: {Hudscott}is a mansion house standing in 22 acres. The buildngs are listed and centred on a medieval hall with a gallery. A chapel was added in the fourteenth century.Other buildings added on include a hunting lodge and an orangery.There are also stables and kennels. The clock tower, which may have also been used as a granary, contains a working turret clock with a chime. It was made by Louis Pridham in 1711. The Saxon spelling was{Hudscot}- meaning Hud's cottage.As a hunting lodge it belonged to the Deputy Forester of the Royal Forest of North Devon. { }Subsequent owners include the Venner and the Rolle families.The Mc.Kenzie family bought the house in 1977.Hudscott is now a private family residence.
